CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: To our best knowledge , the FF is the highest reported to date for side - chain D-A conjugated copolymers The surface morphology of the active layers was studied using atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) under tapping mode in order to further understand why the device exhibited better photovoltaic properties at the annealing temperature of 120 ° C. Figure S8 shows typical AFM topography of the PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM blend film in unannealed and annealed conditions ( see Supporting Information ).

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| FF (FF is an abbreviation, assume it stands for a material property: "Fill Factor") |
| side-chain D-A conjugated copolymers (specific copolymers with side-chains and a D-A conjugated backbone) |
| PBDT-TDPP-S (a specific copolymer: Poly(benzothiadiazole-alt-2,6-di(thiophene-3-yl)pyridine-3,3'-sulfonate)) |
| PC71BM (a specific material: [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester) |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| side-chain D-A conjugated copolymers |
| PBDT-TDPP-S |
| PC71BM |
